member.name: T:Htec.Common.Extensions.CardExtensions
member.summary: string extensions for card values

member.name: M:Htec.Common.Extensions.CardExtensions.GetLuhnCheckDigit(System.String)
member.summary: Algorithm 1. Append a zero check digit to the number and calculate checksum 2. If the (sum mod 10) == 0, then the check digit is 0 3. Else, the check digit = 10 - (sum mod 10)

member.name: M:Htec.Common.Extensions.CardExtensions.IsLuhnDigitCorrect(System.String)
member.summary: Checks that the Luhn digit is correct on the supplied number.
member.returns: true if Check Digit is correct

member.name: M:Htec.Common.Extensions.CardExtensions.FactorLuhnDigit(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Starting with the first digit multiply every other by 2. If result is greater than 9 set it to the sum of the digits or subtract 9 Zero based list 0 = 1, 1 = 2 etc. so to test for even we test for odd.

member.name: M:Htec.Common.Extensions.CardExtensions.GetEanCheckDigit(System.String)
member.summary: Multiplies every other digit by 3 2. If the (sum mod 10) == 0, then the check digit is 0 3. Else, the check digit = 10 - (sum mod 10)

member.name: M:Htec.Common.Extensions.CardExtensions.IsEanDigitCorrect(System.String)
member.summary: Checks that the Luhn digit is correct on the supplied number.

member.name: M:Htec.Common.Extensions.CardExtensions.FactorEanDigit(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Starting with the first digit multiply every other digit by 3 starting with the first one. Zero based list 0 = 1, 1 = 2 etc. so to test for even we test for odd.

member.name: M:Htec.Common.Extensions.CardExtensions.ValidateNumber(System.String)
member.summary: Well, it kind of validates that it is a number!

member.name: M:Htec.Common.Extensions.CardExtensions.GetCheckDigit(System.Int32)
member.summary: Calculates the check digit.

member.summary: Is this card number a Payback card
member.returns: A boolean denoting if number is payback

member.summary: Is this card a valid Deutschland Card

member.summary: Is this card a valid Deutschland barcard

member.summary: Is this card a valid Uk loyalty card.

member.name: M:Htec.Common.Extensions.DictionaryExtensions.TryGetValueOrDefault``2(System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{``0,``1},``0,``1)
member.summary: Try and Get the value based on the key if it exists. Note: This does one scan of the hash table and is considered faster than using ContainsKey (that does 2 scans), but this depends if the hash table is already indexed
member.returns: The value of the key exists, otherwise the default value is returned.

member.name: F:Htec.Common.Extensions.StringExtensions.UriRfc3986CharsToEscape
member.summary: The set of characters that are unreserved in RFC 2396 but are NOT unreserved in RFC 3986.

member.name: M:Htec.Common.Extensions.StringExtensions.EscapeUriDataStringRfc3986(System.String)
member.summary: Escapes a string according to the URI data string rules given in RFC 3986.
member.remarks: The method is supposed to take on RFC 3986 behavior if certain elements are present in a .config file. Even if this actually worked (which in my experiments it doesn't), we can't rely on every host actually having this configuration element present.

member.name: T:Htec.Common.Logger.HtecLogger
member.summary:
This class acts as an abstraction between log4net logging services and all other HTEC implementations. This implementation will hide the log4net ILog interface from other classes and will provide an IHtecLogger interface instead. Calls to IHtecLogger will be forwarded to the relevant method on Log4Net ILog. The only exception to that is the IHtecLogger.Business method which is intended to log messages that customers read.
Creating an instance through the GetLogger method will produce a Logger class with its own named ILog interface. This is intended for the external logging users. i.e.: Partner dlls
The GetLogger instance creation method is thread safe, but the logging methods are not guaranteed to be thread safe.

member.name: F:Htec.Common.Logger.HtecLogger.CreateSync
member.summary: Thread synchronisation object for the static GetLogger method.

member.name: F:Htec.Common.Logger.HtecLogger._log
member.summary: Instantiated for every GetLogger call. Intended to store the log4net.ILog interface to serve logging requests.

member.param: Name used to create the ILog interface

member.name: T:Htec.Common.Logger.Interfaces.IHtecLogger
member.summary: This Interface will be used as an abstraction between Log4Net logging services and all other classes in the DataExhangeFramework solution. This way we can hide the logging related implementation from other classes so they don't depend directly on Log4Net defined types. Calls to IHtecLogger will be forwarded to the relevant method on Log4Net ILog. The only exception is the ILog.Info which is going to be used for our "Business" logging purposes.

member.summary: Generic log method.
member.param: The declaring type of the method that is the stack boundary into the logging system for this call.
The level of the message to be logged.
The exception to log, including its stack trace.
